member.name: F:Buildalyzer.AnalyzerManager.WorkspaceProjectReferences
member.summary: This maps Roslyn project IDs to full normalized project file paths of references (since the Roslyn Project doesn't provide access to this data) which allows us to match references with Roslyn projects that already exist in the Workspace/Solution (instead of rebuilding them). This cache exists in so that it's lifetime can be controlled and it can be collected when goes out of scope.

member.name: P:Buildalyzer.AnalyzerManagerOptions.ProjectFilter
member.summary: A filter that indicates whether a give project should be loaded. Return true to load the project, false to filter it out.

member.name: P:Buildalyzer.Construction.IProjectFile.ContainsPackageReferences
member.summary: Whether the project file contains PackageReference items.

member.name: P:Buildalyzer.Construction.IProjectFile.IsMultiTargeted
member.summary: Whether the project file is multi-targeted.

member.name: P:Buildalyzer.Construction.IProjectFile.PackageReferences
member.summary: The list of PackageReference items in the project file.

member.name: P:Buildalyzer.Construction.IProjectFile.Path
member.summary: The full path to the project file.

member.name: P:Buildalyzer.Construction.IProjectFile.Name
member.summary: Project name.

member.name: P:Buildalyzer.Construction.IProjectFile.RequiresNetFramework
member.summary: Whether the project file requires a .NET Framework host and build tools to build.
member.remarks: Checks for an Import element with a Project attribute ending with one of the targets in . Also looks for a LanguageTargets ending with one of the targets in . Projects that use these targets are known not to build under a .NET Core host or build tools. Also checks for a ToolsVersion attribute and uses the .NET Framework if one is found.

member.name: P:Buildalyzer.Construction.IProjectFile.TargetFrameworks
member.summary: The target framework(s) in the project file.
member.remarks: This does not perform evaluation of the project file, only parsing. If TargetFramework or TargetFrameworks contains a property that needs to be evaluated, this will contain the pre-evaluated value(s). Try to find a TargetFrameworkIdentifier in the same PropertyGroup and if no TargetFrameworkIdentifier was found, assume ".NETFramework".

member.name: P:Buildalyzer.Construction.IProjectFile.ToolsVersion
member.summary: Gets the ToolsVersion attribute of the Project element (or null if there isn't one).

member.name: P:Buildalyzer.Construction.IProjectFile.UsesSdk
member.summary: Whether the project file uses an SDK.
member.remarks: Checks for an Sdk attribute on the Project element. If one can't be found, also checks for Import elements with an Sdk attribute (see https://github.com/Microsoft/msbuild/issues/1493).

member.name: P:Buildalyzer.Construction.IProjectFile.OutputType
member.summary: The output type of the project.

member.name: T:Buildalyzer.Construction.ProjectFile
member.summary: Encapsulates an MSBuild project file and provides some information about it's format. This class only parses the existing XML and does not perform any evaluation.

member.name: F:Buildalyzer.Construction.ProjectFile.ImportsThatRequireNetFramework
member.summary: These imports are known to require a .NET Framework host and build tools.

member.name: T:Buildalyzer.Environment.BuildEnvironment
member.summary: An immutable representation of a particular build environment (paths, properties, etc).

member.name: P:Buildalyzer.Environment.BuildEnvironment.DesignTime
member.summary: Indicates that a design-time build should be performed.

member.name: P:Buildalyzer.Environment.BuildEnvironment.Restore
member.summary: Runs the restore target prior to any other targets using the MSBuild restore switch.

member.name: P:Buildalyzer.Environment.BuildEnvironment.NoAutoResponse
member.summary: Indicates if the -noAutoResponse argument should be set (the default is true). This is required if a .rsp file might conflict with the command-line arguments and binary logger that Buildalyzer uses. Setting this to false will omit the -noAutoResponse argument but might also result in failed builds or incomplete information being sent to Buildalyzer. See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/visualstudio/msbuild/msbuild-response-files.

member.name: M:Buildalyzer.Environment.BuildEnvironment.WithTargetsToBuild(System.String[])
member.summary: Clones the build environment with a different set of build targets.
member.param: The targets that should be used to build the project. Specifying an empty array indicates that the should return a without building the project.
member.returns: A new build environment with the specified targets.

member.name: P:Buildalyzer.Environment.EnvironmentOptions.Preference
member.summary: Indicates a preferences towards the build environment to use. The default is a preference for the .NET Core SDK.

member.name: P:Buildalyzer.Environment.EnvironmentOptions.TargetsToBuild
member.summary: The default targets to build.

member.name: P:Buildalyzer.Environment.EnvironmentOptions.DesignTime
member.summary: Indicates that a design-time build should be performed. The default value is true. Note that when performing a design-time build, the will be ignored and the design-time targets will be used instead.

member.name: P:Buildalyzer.Environment.EnvironmentOptions.Restore
member.summary: Runs the restore target prior to any other targets using the MSBuild restore switch.

member.name: P:Buildalyzer.Environment.EnvironmentOptions.DotnetExePath
member.summary: The full path to the dotnet executable you want to use for the build when building projects using the .NET Core SDK. Defaults to dotnet which will look in folders specified in the path environment variable.
member.remarks: Set this to something else to customize the .NET Core runtime you want to use (I.e., preview versions).

member.name: P:Buildalyzer.Environment.EnvironmentOptions.GlobalProperties
member.summary: The global MSBuild properties to set.

member.name: P:Buildalyzer.Environment.EnvironmentOptions.EnvironmentVariables
member.summary: Environment variables to set.

member.name: P:Buildalyzer.Environment.EnvironmentOptions.Arguments
member.summary: Additional MSBuild command-line arguments to use.

member.name: F:Buildalyzer.Environment.EnvironmentPreference.Core
member.summary: This will prefer the .NET Core SDK if it's available and will use the .NET Framework build tools if the project type is known not to support the .NET Core SDK or the .NET Core SDK can't be found.

member.name: F:Buildalyzer.Environment.EnvironmentPreference.Framework
member.summary: This will prefer the .NET Framework build tools if they're available and will use the .NET Code SDK if the project type is known not to support the .NET Framework build tools or the .NET Framework build tools can't be found.

member.name: T:Buildalyzer.GuidUtility
member.summary: Helper methods for working with .

member.name: M:Buildalyzer.GuidUtility.Create(System.Guid,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a name-based UUID using the algorithm from RFC 4122 ยง4.3.
member.param: The ID of the namespace.
The name (within that namespace).
member.returns: A UUID derived from the namespace and name.

member.name: M:Buildalyzer.GuidUtility.Create(System.Guid,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a name-based UUID using the algorithm from RFC 4122 ยง4.3.
member.param: The ID of the namespace.
The name (within that namespace).
The version number of the UUID to create; this value must be either 3 (for MD5 hashing) or 5 (for SHA-1 hashing).
member.returns: A UUID derived from the namespace and name.

member.name: F:Buildalyzer.GuidUtility.DnsNamespace
member.summary: The namespace for fully-qualified domain names (from RFC 4122, Appendix C).

member.name: F:Buildalyzer.GuidUtility.UrlNamespace
member.summary: The namespace for URLs (from RFC 4122, Appendix C).

member.name: F:Buildalyzer.GuidUtility.IsoOidNamespace
member.summary: The namespace for ISO OIDs (from RFC 4122, Appendix C).

member.name: M:Buildalyzer.IAnalyzerManager.Analyze(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.Build.Framework.ILogger})
member.summary: Analyzes an MSBuild binary log file.
member.param: The path to the binary log file.
MSBuild loggers to replay events from the log to.
member.returns: A dictionary of target frameworks to .

member.name: P:Buildalyzer.IAnalyzerResult.Analyzer
member.summary: Gets the that generated this result or null if the result came from a binary log file.

member.name: P:Buildalyzer.IAnalyzerResult.PackageReferences
member.summary: Contains the PackageReference items for the project. The key is a package ID and the value is a that includes all the package reference metadata, typically including a "Version" key.

member.name: P:Buildalyzer.IAnalyzerResult.ProjectFilePath
member.summary: The full normalized path to the project file.

member.name: P:Buildalyzer.IAnalyzerResult.ProjectGuid
member.summary: Gets a GUID for the project. This first attempts to get the ProjectGuid MSBuild property. If that's not available, checks for a GUID from the solution (if originally provided). If neither of those are available, it will generate a UUID GUID by hashing the project path relative to the solution path (so it's repeatable).

member.name: P:Buildalyzer.IAnalyzerResult.Command
member.summary: Gets the compiler command produced by the CoreCompile task. This is + .

member.name: P:Buildalyzer.IAnalyzerResult.CompilerFilePath
member.summary: Gets the path of the compiler command produced by the CoreCompile task.

member.name: P:Buildalyzer.IAnalyzerResult.CompilerArguments
member.summary: Gets the arguments passed to the compiler produced by the CoreCompile task.

member.name: M:Buildalyzer.IAnalyzerResult.GetProperty(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of the specified property and returns null if the property could not be found.
member.param: The name of the property.
member.returns: The value of the property or null.

member.name: P:Buildalyzer.IProjectAnalyzer.EnvironmentVariables
member.summary: The environment variables for MSBuild to be used for every build from this analyzer.
member.remarks: Additional environment variables may be added or changed by individual build environment.

member.name: P:Buildalyzer.IProjectAnalyzer.GlobalProperties
member.summary: The global properties for MSBuild to be used for every build from this analyzer.
member.remarks: Additional global properties may be added or changed by individual build environment.

member.name: P:Buildalyzer.IProjectAnalyzer.IgnoreFaultyImports
member.summary: Controls whether empty, invalid, and missing targets should be ignored during project load.

member.name: P:Buildalyzer.IProjectAnalyzer.ProjectGuid
member.summary: Gets a GUID for the project. This checks for a GUID from the solution (if originally provided). If this isn't available, it will generate a UUID GUID by hashing the project path relative to the solution path (so it's repeatable).

member.name: M:Buildalyzer.IProjectAnalyzer.Build
member.summary: Builds the project without specifying a target framework. In a multi-targeted project this will return a for each target framework.
member.returns: The result of the build process.

member.name: M:Buildalyzer.IProjectAnalyzer.Build(Buildalyzer.Environment.BuildEnvironment)
member.summary: Builds the project without specifying a target framework. In a multi-targeted project this will return a for each target framework.
member.param: The build environment to use for the build.
member.returns: The result of the build process.

member.name: M:Buildalyzer.IProjectAnalyzer.Build(Buildalyzer.Environment.EnvironmentOptions)
member.summary: Builds the project without specifying a target framework. In a multi-targeted project this will return a for each target framework.
member.param: The environment options to use for the build.
member.returns: The result of the build process.

member.name: M:Buildalyzer.IProjectAnalyzer.Build(System.String)
member.summary: Builds a specific target framework. In a multi-targeted project this will still return a for each target framework, but the target framework(s) not specified may be empty.
member.param: The target framework to build.
member.returns: The result of the build process.

The build environment to use for the build.

member.param: The target framework to build.
The environment options to use for the build.
member.returns: The result of the build process.

member.param: The set of target frameworks to build.
member.returns: A dictionary of target frameworks to .

member.param: The set of target frameworks to build.
The build environment to use for the build.
member.returns: A dictionary of target frameworks to .

The environment options to use for the build.

member.name: M:Buildalyzer.IProjectAnalyzer.AddBuildLogger(Microsoft.Build.Framework.ILogger)
member.summary: Adds an MSBuild logger to the build. Note that this may have a large penalty on build performance.
member.remarks: Normally, the minimum required amount of log events are forwarded from the MSBuild process to Buildalyzer. By attaching arbitrary loggers, MSBuild must forward every log event so the logger has a chance to handle it.
member.param: The logger to add.

member.name: M:Buildalyzer.IProjectAnalyzer.RemoveBuildLogger(Microsoft.Build.Framework.ILogger)
member.summary: Removes an MSBuild logger from the build.
member.param: The logger to remove.
